questions.text: What did Woody's new apartment have?
questions.explanation:
cable.

	Sam asked him if he watched "Robocop" last night. Woody replied, "No the cable was out."

questions.text: Who got a role in a commercial?
questions.explanation:
Woody.

	He got a role playing a bartender. He was nervous about it, and Carla told him he was a bartender. He said he had to talk to customers and pour beer. Sam told him he did that everyday at work. Woody said, "Great now you've made me nervous about doing my job."

questions.text: What was the line spoken in the commercial?
questions.explanation:
I like it.

	It took a couple of takes for Woody to get it right because Sam and Norm had made him laugh. They weren't doing anything funny, but Cliff who was acting silly couldn't make him laugh. After Woody said, "Thank you for not being funny, Mr. Clavin."

questions.text: How long had Woody been in Boston?
questions.explanation:
5 years.

	Woody was surprised he got the commercial. He said they wanted a young fresh face which he had when he first moved to Boston, but time changed a man.

questions.text: How many cases of Veggie Boy did Rebecca order?
questions.explanation:
23.

	She said they were the first ones to have it and the first taste was going to Woody. Woody tried it and thought it was disgusting.

questions.text: Who felt like he was a liar?
questions.explanation:
Woody.

	Woody was upset that on the commercial he said "I like it" when he actually hated Veggie Boy. He got upset every time he heard the commercial play.

questions.text: What did Frasier say was not a good idea?
questions.explanation:
kale.

	Veggie Boy was made up of broccoli, cauliflower and kale. Apparently it was the kale that made it taste so bad. Kale is a green leafy vegetable that is often used as garnish in restaurants.

questions.text: When did Sam say he got cut from the Red Sox?
questions.explanation:
His birthday.

	Sam was trying to make Woody feel better by telling a story about a guy who got cut from the Sox on his birthday. It turned out the story was about him, and everything was a lie except the fact that it was his birthday. Woody heard it was a lie and said, "Happy birthday, liar."

questions.text: Who did Lilith say had outdated ideas?
questions.explanation:
Sigmund Freud.

	Frasier was a huge Freud fan and practiced psychoanalysis himself. Lilith often scoffed at some of the ideas that Frasier talked about saying they were outdated. Lilith was a Behaviorist (B.F. Skinner).

Woody.

	Woody was hypnotized to believe he liked Veggie Boy. It worked a little too well. Veggie Boy ended up not selling and therefore got discontinued. Woody said, "How can anyone not like Veggie Boy, it's broccoli, cauliflower and kale. Has the world gone mad?"
